channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken drainage grid at passing place on Dog Lane, 16th January
item.description:
There is a passing place on Dog Lane just below Dark Lane. Unwitting drivers pull into this to allow cars to pass and get stuck in the deep hole created by this sunken drain cover. Last week I witnessed a van driver having the panel above his wheel ripped off as he tried to extricate himself from this hole. This time it was just a panel but it could be more serious. The cover needs to be raised to road level or this part of the road bollarded in some form to avoid this safety issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain with flow of water breaking up previous repair to road, 16th January
item.description:
This drain on Dog Lane is opposite the pull in area used primarily by dog walkers just above the junction with Dark Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing light STILL FAULTY!, 16th January
item.description:
Contrary to report saying this has been fixed, the push button for the pedestrian crossing across Cheltenham Road still switches off before the pedestrian light turns green so traffic doesn’t stop. You have to keep button pressed so it doesn’t switch off.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Pothole alongside Willowbank on Dog Lane, 16th January
item.description:
This pothole is adjacent to a recent repair by yourselves outside Willowbank on Dog Lane. Given the poor state of the lane in general it is disappointing to see persistent patching leaving other adjacent areas that will inevitably cause a problem within a matter of weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on Dog Lane between The Kneelings and The Uplands fields, 16th January
item.description:
On this corner the road surface has dropped and the problem is now exacerbated by the pot hole. This is just below an area used to pull in to let vehicles pass and between the panelled fence area of The Kneelings field and the field to The Uplands. The photo shows exactly where the problem is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip in Mill Lane (Ham Road end), 16th January
item.description:
The fly tip at the location is just in the verge on the right hand side of the road going from the Ham Road end. It is just past the cottage seen on the right hand side and before the entrance to Mill Croft on the left hand side - look carefully as it consists of Black Sacks and some other rubbish which were a bit difficult to see. Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole formed just off the junction heading towards Home Farm., 16th January
item.description:
The 9 potholes reported early December in Brockhampton Road from this junction towards STW treatment works have NOT been repaired though you advise you repaired one today! This is NOT true and the white markings have warn away due to the long time!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
